newsitem.title: FRANCE: Lufthansa says Frankfurt-Spain services hit.
newsitem.headline: Lufthansa says Frankfurt-Spain services hit.

text.p: Lufthansa Cargo AG (LHAG) said its trucking services between Frankfurt and Spain were being hit by the Spanish lorry drivers dispute.
"We have decided to cancel our twice-weekly Frankfurt-Bordeaux-Bilbao import service tomorrow, for the third time in the past week," a Bordeaux-based Lufthansa official told Reuters.
One of Lufthansa's trucks had been blocked at the French-Spanish border for about a week while another, en route to Portugal, had fared better, managing to turn back, the official said.

Wherever possible, space was being made available for perishable freight aboard Lufthansa's scheduled passenger services between cities such as Madrid and Bilbao and Frankfurt but the fact that the airline operated small aircraft -- Boeing 737s and Airbus A320s-- on these routes meant capacity was limited, the official added.
Another major European airline, which operates several daily trucking services into Spain, said in some cases it had managed to escape the road blocks.
"However, overall there are currently low levels of freight on Spanish routes with shippers choosing not to run the risk of cargo becoming trapped," he added.
